div.p: RESPONSETYPE is an optional attribute attached to the element RRESPONSES (belonging to WRITING RECEPTION ) that specifies the historical timing of a response to a written work through its values of recent, re-evaluation, or initial. The two sibling attributes are FORMALITY and GENDEREDRESPONSE.

div.codeblock: <RRESPONSES RESPONSETYPE="re-evaluation" FORMALITY="formal">An attack on Joanna Baillie's work in 1803 by Francis Jeffrey signalled the decline of her reputation.</RRESPONSES>
<RRESPONSES RESPONSETYPE="initial">Elizabeth Cellier's book provoked about twenty replies at first, attacking and defending.</RRESPONSES>
<RRESPONSES RESPONSETYPE="recent"> In recent years, Hannah More has received much blame for her treatment of Yearsley.</RRESPONSES>

div.p: Use one value of RESPONSETYPE to indicate whether a response to a work occurred at or close to the time of its publication (initial) or recently (recent). Re-evaluation is used for a time which is neither initial nor recent, or also when there has been (at any time) a significant re-evaluation of a woman writer's work and its worth. Obviously judgement is involved in deciding, for instance, how recent is recent.
